question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign()] [Cast truncation] When casting 'rk as usize' and 'k as usize' at line 78, can values larger than usize::MAX on 32-bit systems cause truncation errors? (Low)

(Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign()] [Division by zero] Can 'm' ever be zero in the expression 'n / (2 * m)' at line 86, or can overflow in '2 * m' cause division errors? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign()] [pow_vartime timing leak] Does pow_vartime at line 86 leak the exponent value through timing side-channels, potentially revealing domain size information to attackers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign()] [Loop invariant violation] Can the outer loop at line 83 ('for _ in 0..log_n') execute with log_n > 32, causing 'm *= 2' at line 104 to overflow and break loop invariants? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign()] [Stride calculation error] At line 101, does 'k += 2 * m' correctly compute the next stride, or can '2 * m' overflow causing incorrect butterfly grouping? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign()] [M doubling overflow] At line 104, when 'm *= 2', can m exceed u32::MAX causing overflow and breaking the FFT stage iteration? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign()] [Twiddle accumulation] At line 98, does 'w.mul_assign(&w_m)' correctly accumulate twiddle factors, or can accumulated rounding errors introduce mathematical incorrectness? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign()] [Field arithmetic correctness] Do the sub_assign (line 95) and add_assign (line 97) operations correctly implement butterfly arithmetic in the scalar field without modular reduction errors? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign_g1()] [G1 point validity] During butterfly operations at lines 139-144, can intermediate G1Projective point additions produce invalid points outside the G1 subgroup? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign_g1()] [Identity point handling] If butterfly operations involve the identity point in G1, do lines 139-144 handle it correctly without introducing errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign_g1()] [Code duplication divergence] Since serial_fft_assign_g1 is duplicated from serial_fft_assign (line 108 comment), can future updates to one function but not the other introduce inconsistent behavior? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign_g2()] [Performance attack vector] Since G2 operations are ~3x slower than G1, can an attacker force FFT operations on large G2 point arrays to degrade validator cryptographic performance? (Medium)
